snippet: The president made his choice despite concerns that it concentrates too much power in the hands of a single military official.
lead_paragraph: The president made his choice despite concerns that it concentrates too much power in the hands of a single military official.
abstract: Pres Obama decides to keep the National Security Agency and the Pentagon’s cyberwarfare branch Cyber Command under the same command; makes choice despite concerns that it concentrates too much power in hands of a single military official responsible for both surveillance and directing a growing arsenal of cyberweapons.

headline.main: Obama to Keep Security Agency and Cyberwarfare Under a Single Commander
headline.print_headline: Obama to Keep Security Agency and Cyberwarfare Under a Single Commander

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and THOM SHANKER
